metadata.title: CVE-2021-47503 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: scsi:pm80xx: Do not call scsi_remove_host() in pm8001_alloc() Callingscsi_remove_host() before scsi_add_host() results in a crash: BUG: kernelNULL pointer dereference, address: 0000000000000108 RIP:0010:device_del+0x63/0x440 Call Trace: device_unregister+0x17/0x60scsi_remove_host+0xee/0x2a0 pm8001_pci_probe+0x6ef/0x1b90 [pm80xx]local_pci_probe+0x3f/0x90 We cannot call scsi_remove_host() inpm8001_alloc() because scsi_add_host() has not been called yet at thatpoint in time. Function call tree: pm8001_pci_probe() | `-pm8001_pci_alloc() | | | `- pm8001_alloc() | | | `- scsi_remove_host() | `-scsi_add_host()

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
